result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Bruce Lillyblad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Bruce Lillyblad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Bruce Lillyblad was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Bruce Lillyblad

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
TO ALSO INCLUDE 12CF155 and 15CM93:
  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle.  ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley and Megan Kelly   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Robert Bruce Lillyblad did not appear. Case called at 9:35 a.m. Court reviews file. Motion filed by Atty Repka regarding modifying sentence. Atty Repka requesting to continue this matter so defendant can be here in person or appear via video conferencing. ADA McKinley gives argument and objects. Court rules that we will continue with this hearing today. Atty Repka states that the defendant wishes to serve his sentence at St Croix County Jail so he can be placed into a treatment program. ADA McKinley gives argument and objection. Court reviewed file again. Court declines at this time to modify sentence and denies the motion at this time. Adjourned at 9:46 a.m.
TO RMW from Atty Sienko that he no longer represents defendant in any legal matter.
RMW received letter from defendant. Letter in return sent to Atty Sienko from JA to schedule a motion hearing.
of April 17th, 2015 Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Held before the Honorable Scott R. Needham. Filed by RPR Kasten. km
c: Def, Atty, DA, HPD & Jail. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY:  David Leon Sienko DF:  Robert Bruce Lillyblad appeared from jail. Case called at 8:11. Attty. Sienko updates the court. ADA Nieskes responds.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 3 in 15CM93 as a repeater. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. DE acknowledges priors. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 in 15CM93 as a repeat offender. Court takes judicial notice of 12CF155. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 and 2 in 15CM93 with prejudice. Sentencing arguments. DE is on a probation hold. DE has day treatment set up for next week. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: 
-  60 days in St. Croix County Jail with credit for 44 days. 
-  $750.00 inclusive of costs
Bond to be forfeited.
Plea hearing on April 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.
David Sienko  15R 005194. eif
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marcie L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: TCH for HWC, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Robert Bruce Lillyblad appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Demand speedy trial. Defendant is on a PO hold.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
